Meaning: to continue writing
Sentences: 彼は手紙を書き続ける。
Translation: He has been writing a letter.

Meaning: to keep walking
Sentences: あきらめずに歩き続ければ、進歩するでしょう。
Translation: Then that animosity is being passed on down to us?

Meaning: to continue to receive
Sentences: じゃあ僕らはその腹いせ受け続けるんですか？
Translation: Then that animosity is being passed on down to us?

Meaning: to hold onto, to persist in, to maintain
Sentences: 一社の株を持ち続ける。
Translation: Holding on to the stock of one company

Meaning: to hit repeatedly
Sentences: 庭に水を打ち続けた。
Translation: He kept watering the garden.

Meaning: to keep running
Sentences: 走り続けると明かりが見えてきた。
Translation: As we continued running, we saw lights.

Meaning: to think constantly, to dwell on
Sentences: 彼は去っていった妻のことをいつまでも思い続けた。
Translation: He kept on thinking of the wife who had left him.

Meaning: to keep standing
Sentences: 私は教師として30年教壇に立ち続けてきた。
Translation: I have been a teacher for 30 years.

Meaning: to continue to work
Sentences: 僕は働き続けるには疲れすぎていた。
Translation: I was too tired to keep working.

Meaning: to continue to increase
Sentences: どの町にもコンビニが増え続ける。
Translation: Convenience stores continue to increase in every town.

Meaning: to maintain, to continue to have
Sentences: 温度を一定に保ち続ける。
Translation: Maintain a constant temperature.

Meaning: to keep talking
Sentences: 待遇の改善を会社側に言い続けている。
Translation: We are continuing to request better conditions from the company.

Meaning: to continue riding
Sentences: 彼女はいつもファーストクラスに乗り続ける。
Translation: She's always flying first class.

Meaning: to continue to rain or snow
Sentences: 明日で５日間雪が降り続くことになる。
Translation: It will continue to snow for five days tomorrow.

Meaning: to continue, to occur in succession, to come next
Sentences: 式に引き続いてパーティーがあった。
Translation: Following the ceremony, there was a party.

Meaning: to go to see, to visit
Sentences: 平均して、月に二回映画を見に行きます。
Translation: On average, I go to the movies twice a month.

Meaning: to go on a trip, to go out to play, to go and visit
Sentences: 外に遊びに行ってもいいですか。
Translation: Can I go outside to play?

Meaning: to diffuse, to spread throughout, to become widespread
Sentences: その報道は全国に行き渡った。
Translation: The news report went around the country.

Meaning: to be scrupulous, to be attentive, to be prudent, to be thorough
Sentences: 彼は何事にも行き届いた人だ。
Translation: He is a man who is good at everything.

Meaning: to roll up, to enfold, to swallow up, to involve, to drag into
Sentences: 我々は交通事故に巻きこまれた。
Translation: We were involved in a traffic accident.

Meaning: to apply, to make an application, to propose, to offer
Sentences: 何人社員が転部を申し込んで来ましたか。
Translation: How many employees applied for a transfer?

Meaning: to meet by coincidence while one is out
Sentences: 私は昔の友達とばったり行き合った。
Translation: I happened to run into an old friend.

Meaning: to go too far, to go past, to go to extremes, to overdo it
Sentences: うっかり彼女の家を行き過ぎて戻った。
Translation: I thoughtlessly went past her house and came back.

Meaning: to expect a good result and depend on it
Sentences: 彼はボーナスを当て込んでいた。
Translation: He was counting on getting his bonus.

Meaning: to explain well to be able to sell
Sentences: 彼は新しい製品を取引先に安い価格で売り込んだ。
Translation: He sold the new product to his client at a low price.

Meaning: to chase and put inside
Sentences: 彼は鶏をかごに追い込んだ。
Translation: He chased the chicken into the cage.

Meaning: to teach until the material is completely understood
Sentences: 子供に勉強を教え込んだ。
Translation: I drilled the children in their lessons.

Meaning: to push and (forcibly) put something in
Sentences: 彼は子供のポケットにお金を押し込んだ。
Translation: The parent shoved some money into the child’s pocket.

Meaning: be in time for
Sentences: 僕は終電にすれすれのところで間に合った。
Translation: I was just in time for the last train.

Meaning: to dis cuss, to talk together
Sentences: 彼と私はごみ問題の再利用の点から話し合った。
Translation: He and I discussed the waste problem in terms of recycling.

Meaning: to associate with, to keep company with, to go out with, to steady with, to go along with
Sentences: あんなウダツがあがらない男といつまで付き合ってるの。
Translation: How long are you going to be seeing that loser of a boyfriend?

Meaning: to get to know someone, to make acquaintance
Sentences: 私は２週間前に彼女と知り合った。
Translation: I became acquainted with her two weeks ago.

Meaning: to help each other, to cooperate
Sentences: 学園祭を成功させるために彼らは互いに助け合った。
Translation: They helped one another to make the school festival a success.

Meaning: to get along with someone
Sentences: 彼らは妙おたがいに気が合う。
Translation: They have a strange affinity for each other.

Meaning: to share
Sentences: 支払いは分け合いましょう。
Translation: Let's split the bill.

Meaning: to balance, to be in harmony, to suit, to go well together
Sentences: 彼女の服と色と靴の色はよく釣り合っている。
Translation: The color of her dress and that of her shoes go well together.

Meaning: to suit one’s taste
Sentences: そのコーヒーは私口に合わなかった。
Translation: The coffee was not much to my liking.

Meaning: to be tired of hearing
Sentences: 私は聞きあきた。
Translation: I am tired of hearing.

Meaning: to get tired of eating, had enough of food
Sentences: 毎日寿司を食べていたのに寿司は食べ飽きない。
Translation: I ate sushi every day and never got tired of eating sushi.

Meaning: to cut out, to clip from, to extract
Sentences: 彼は新聞から広告を切り抜いた。
Translation: He cut the advertisement out of the newspaper.

Meaning: to outwit, to outmaneuver, to anticipate
Sentences: あの男を出し抜いてやった。
Translation: I outwitted him.

Meaning: to pull out, to extract, to draw out, to lure away, to poach, to entice
Sentences: 彼はライバル会社に引き抜かれました。
Translation: He was poached by a rival company.

Meaning: to shoot out ( lights, window, etc)
Sentences: 彼は最初の一発で的の中心を撃ち抜いた。
Translation: He hit the center of the target with his first shot.

Meaning: to think thoroughly
Sentences: 私はあらゆる困難について考え抜いた。
Translation: I thought out all the difficulties.

Meaning: to use up, to squander
Sentences: 彼は体力をすべて使い果たした。
Translation: He exhausted all his energy.

Meaning: to get tired out, to be exhausted
Sentences: 長い距離を歩いて疲れ果てた。
Translation: I exhausted myself by walking a long distance.

Meaning: to be at a complete loss, to have absolutely no idea what to do
Sentences: 私はこの難問に困り果てている。
Translation: I'm at my wit's end with this difficult problem.

Meaning: to fall into ruin, to be desolated
Sentences: その古城は荒れ果てたままになっていた。
Translation: The old castle lay in ruins.

Meaning: to re place, to move, to change the position of
Sentences: 現在のバージョンは、アップグレード版で置き換えます。
Translation: We will replace the current version with the upgrade.

Meaning: to come and stay, to drop in, to visit
Sentences: 週末遊びに来ませんか。
Translation: Won't you come and see me this weekend?

Meaning: to cone and see, to visit
Sentences: たった５２９人の観客しか試合を見に来なかった。
Translation: A mere 529 spectators watched the game.

Meaning: to get mad, to be highly offended, to get pissed off
Sentences: あいつは、まったく頭にくるやつだ。
Translation: That guy really burns me up.

Meaning: to press, to push, to force
Sentences: 自分の考えを僕に押しつけるな。
Translation: Don't press your opinion on me.

Meaning: to push aside
Sentences: 彼は群集を押し分けて進んだ。
Translation: He pushed his way through the crowd.

Meaning: to meet by coincidence while one is out
Sentences: 私は昔の友達とばったり行き合った。
Translation: I happened to run into an old friend.

Meaning: to guarantee that something is certain
Sentences: 彼の人柄は私が請け合います。
Translation: I can vouch for his character.

Meaning: to accept with responsibility
Sentences: できない仕事を請け合ってはいけません。
Translation: We must not accept any work that we cannot do.

Meaning: to strike each other
Sentences: 剣士は互いに打ち合った。
Translation: The kendoka struck each other.

Meaning: to push each other
Sentences: 子供たちは押し合った。
Translation: The children pushed each other.

Meaning: to get together at a certain place
Sentences: 私は友達と駅で落ち合った。
Translation: I met up with my friend at the station.

Meaning: to reach an agreement, to compromise
Sentences: 両者の条件がようやく折り合った。
Translation: The two parties finally found a way to accommodate each other’s conditions.

Meaning: to have a relationship
Sentences: あの人と関わり合いたくない。
Translation: I don't want to have anything to do with that person.

Meaning: to negotiate with the other person
Sentences: 彼は店員に値引きを掛け合った。
Translation: He tried to haggle with the shopkeeper to lower the price.

Meaning: to tell each other
Sentences: 私は友人と将来の夢を語り合った。
Translation: My friend and I shared our dreams for the future.

Meaning: to become entangled with each other
Sentences: 犬どうしが互いに絡み合った。
Translation: The dogs have gotten into a fight with each other.

Meaning: to fight each other and attempt to cut each other down
Sentences: 剣豪は挑戦者と切り合った。
Translation: The expert swordsman and his challenger took part in a sword fight.

Meaning: to be crowded because many people are gathered
Sentences: 車内が通勤客で混み合っている。
Translation: The train car is packed with commuters.

Meaning: to come into conflict, to battle each other
Sentences: 彼は強敵と差し合って勝った。
Translation: He did battle with a formidable foe and won.

Meaning: to get to know each other and start interacting
Sentences: 私はニューヨークで彼と知り合った。
Translation: I first got to know him in New York.

Meaning: to attack each other
Sentences: 両方のチームが攻め合った。
Translation: Both teams went on the offensive.

Meaning: to compete and try to obtain
Sentences: 彼は弟と一等賞を競り合った。
Translation: He and his brother competed for first place.

Meaning: to compete, to dispute.
Sentences: 剣術士はお互いに立ち合った。
Translation: The two swordsmen faced each other in a standoff.

Meaning: to hug each other
Sentences: 彼は戦友と抱き合った。
Translation: He embraced his old wartime buddy.

Meaning: to be understandable to each other
Sentences: 彼らは何も話さなくてもお互いに心が通じ合っている。
Translation: Even if they don't say a word, they can still understand each other.

Meaning: to be dating (someone)
Sentences: 私は彼と付き合っている。
Translation: I'm dating him.

Meaning: to associate with, to accompany someone
Sentences: 彼らは食事に付き合った。
Translation: They shared a meal with me.

Meaning: to go well together, to be balanced, to be in harmony
Sentences: 彼は彼女と釣り合っている。
Translation: He is a good match for her.

Meaning: to melt and become one
Sentences: 新しい文化と古い文化が溶け合っている。
Translation: The new and old cultures have fused into one.

Meaning: to grasp each other's hands
Sentences: 彼らは友達と手を取り合って喜んだ。
Translation: They grasped their friends' hands and rejoiced.

Meaning: to join hands, to fight for
Sentences: 彼は友達と１つのゲームを取り合った。
Translation: He and his friends fought over one game.

Meaning: to not take seriously
Sentences: 彼は訪問者をまったく取り合わなかった。
Translation: He completely neglected his guests.

Meaning: to punch each other
Sentences: 彼は友達と殴り合ってけんかした。
Translation: He came to blows with his friend and they fought.

Meaning: to hold mutually
Sentences: 彼は友達と手を握り合った。
Translation: He and his friend held hands.

Meaning: to glare at each other
Sentences: 二人はにらみ合って立っていた。
Translation: They stood glaring at each other.

Meaning: to be in competition
Sentences: 彼は親友といつも張り合っている。
Translation: He and his best friend are always competing with each other.

Meaning: to pull at each other
Sentences: 磁石のＮ極とＳ極が引き合う。
Translation: The north and south poles of magnets are attracted to each other.

Meaning: to have profit from a deal
Sentences: この仕事は採算的に引き合わない。
Translation: This job just does not pay.

Meaning: to touch each other, to interact familiarly
Sentences: 私はいろいろな国の人と触れ合いたい
Translation: I want to interact with people from all over the world.

Meaning: to collide with great momentum
Sentences: 両者はまっこうからぶつかり合って妥協の余地がない。
Translation: The two sides collide head-on, leaving no room for compromise.

Meaning: to mix together
Sentences: 混じり合うのほうが普通。
Translation: Mixed is more common.

Meaning: to be mixed together, to be blended
Sentences: ニューヨークは多様な文化が混じり合った町だ。
Translation: New York is a town where a variety of cultures intermingle.

Meaning: to face each other's fronts
Sentences: 二人は向かい合って座った。
Translation: They sat facing each other.

Meaning: to face each other
Sentences: 教師は逃げずに困難な課題に向き合うべきだ。
Translation: Teachers should face difficult challenges without running away from them.

Meaning: to meet unexpectedly
Sentences: オークションで欲しかった品物に巡り会った。
Translation: I happened to find at an auction something that I had sought for a long time.

Meaning: to shove each other with neither compromising.
Sentences: 警官は犯人と揉み合った際に拳銃を奪われた。
Translation: The policeman lost his gun when he grappled with the culprit.

Meaning: to dispute with each other
Sentences: 二人の党首は、テレビ討論で激しくやり合った。
Translation: The two party heads sparred with each other in the televised debates.

Meaning: to meet by coincidence while one is out.
Sentences: 私は昔の友達とばったり行き合った。
Translation: I happened to run into an old friend.

Meaning: to give to each other
Sentences: 現代社会では譲り合う気持ちが大切です。
Translation: A generous spirit is very important in our modern society.

Meaning: to bring together mutually
Sentences: 二人は肩を寄せ合って星空を眺めた。
Translation: They stood shoulder to shoulder and gazed up at the stars.

Meaning: to gather (come together) in one place
Sentences: 彼らが寄り合えばいつも高校時代の話に花が咲く。
Translation: Whenever they stop by, they always talk about their high school days.

Meaning: to discuss with each other
Sentences: 彼らは日本の将来を論じ合った。
Translation: They discussed the future of Japan.

Meaning: to share with one another
Sentences: 彼女は恋人と受賞の喜びを分かち合った。
Translation: She shared with her boyfriend the joy of winning the award

Meaning: to understand each other
Sentences: キミは彼女と気持ちを分かり合う努力が必要だ。
Translation: You and your girlfriend need to make an effort to understand each other's feelings.

Meaning: to share with each other
Sentences: 喜びも悲しみも分け合うのが本当の友達だ。
Translation: A true friend is one who shares both joys and sorrows.

Meaning: to dispute with (an adversary), debate heatedly
Sentences: 野党議員は首相と互角に渡り合った。
Translation: Opposition members went toe-to-toe with the prime minister.

Meaning: to put together several things and make one unit
Sentences: 和風と洋風を組み合わせた建物。
Translation: A building that combines Japanese and European elements.

Meaning: to run up, dash up, rush up
Sentences: 彼女は寺の階段を駆け上がった。
Translation: She ran up the temple steps.

Meaning: to clear up
Sentences: 空はすぐに晴れ上がるでしょう。
Translation: The sky will soon clear up.

Meaning: to move up, be advance, carried forward
Sentences: 受付時間が繰り上がることもあるので気を付けて下さい。
Translation: Please note that the reception time may be moved up.

Meaning: to get tired of drinking
Sentences: このワインはもう飲み飽きたよ。
Translation: I'm tired of drinking this wine.

Meaning: to be tired of looking at​
Sentences: この動画は何度も見たので見飽きたよ。
Translation: I've seen this video so many times I'm tired of watching it.
